column4: I rebooted Ubuntu and now it says no network devices were found, what do I do to get them back??
I can't, I'm on a different computer
then no way to troubleshoot it; come back when you are on it.
I can't connect on that computer because there is no way to connect if it thinks it has no network devices...
you can still copy the relevant lines and paste to paste.ubuntu.com ; use a flash key
until you provide that info you are stuck.
lspci shows my ethernet controller but not my wireless, but neither shows up in network manager
we need to know the chipset of the wifi; is is usb pcmcia or internal
internal, it's broadcom, it worked before rebooting, but now it doesn't
I've been using the restricted driver for it, it seems that perhaps todays updates screwed it
what was updated? what kernel are you using?
2.6.24-19-generic, I can't remember what exactly updated, but I know the updates were first available today in the repos
how did you get the broadcom working? ndiswrapper the fw-cutter or other
I just used the restricted drivers from the administration menu
